response.original_title: Homo Argentum: Peter Capusotto y sus videos
response.overview: Homo Argentum (Argentina, 2025) is a feature film directed/produced/edited by Anlu and scripted by Pedro Saborido and Diego Capusotto. The film comprises forty short films, all starring the same actor, Diego Capusotto, who plays a different character in each case.  They explore the particularities of Argentine culture with humor and self-criticism. Each story, with a satirical tone, reflects customs, behaviors, and attitudes unique to the country, inviting reflection through laughter and highlighting cinema's ability to portray aspects of national identity.  The following audiovisual material is a parody of the film "Homo Argentum," directed and written by Mariano Cohn and Gastón Duprat, starring Guillermo Francella (only in theaters, coming soon to Disney+).  The sketches were created by Diego Capusotto and Pedro Saborido, and originally aired on the program "Peter Capusotto y sus videos." Videos available on YouTube.
response.tagline: Forty mini-movies in one big movie
